metadata.title: CVE-2016-9390 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - negligible
metadata.description:
The jas_seq2d_create function in jas_seq.c in JasPer before 1.900.14 allowsremote attackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure) via acrafted image file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9390` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjasper-runtime - 1.900.1-14ubuntu3.5
libjasper1 - 1.900.1-14ubuntu3.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: jasper package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.900.1-14ubuntu3.5').
